meanings.definition: To hang a person in a cage or on a gibbet as a form of execution or public display.
meanings.sent1: The cruel ruler was gibbeting the criminal for all to see.
meanings.sent2: They gibbet criminals to show others the consequences of their actions.
meanings.sent3: The town decided to gibbet the scarecrow to teach the mischievous crows a lesson.
meanings.sent4: His guilt was gibbeted in the eyes of the townspeople.
meanings.sent5: The image of the gibbeted criminal haunted the dreams of the villagers.

meanings.definition: The act of displaying a dead body in a gibbet as a warning or punishment.
meanings.sent1: The gibbeting of the outlaw was a grim sight for all who passed by.
meanings.sent2: The gibbeting of criminals was a common practice in medieval times.
meanings.sent3: The children found humor in pretending to gibbet their toys as a spooky game.
meanings.sent4: The gibbeting of the criminal served as a chilling reminder to the townspeople.
meanings.sent5: The gibbeting of the pirate's body was a macabre spectacle for the curious onlookers.
